results.title: Sticky fingers
results.creator_credit: Joannna N Rosner and Aptos Film Productions
results.brief_description: A training film for shopowners and law enforcement officers showing typical shoplifting methods and explaining how to deter and detect them. Starring Mike Connors.

results.title: Step right up!
results.creator_credit: Mike Lloyd Ross, Ray Jewell and Film Communications
results.brief_description: Illustrates the possible hazards and improper procedures when using ladders. Shows the proper use of stepladders, straight ladders, and extension ladders. Also focuses on inspection, maintenance, carrying, ladder stances, erecting and securing, climbing and descending. Camera: Peter Good.

results.title: Steady
results.creator_credit: Herman Van Der Horst and Cinetone Studios
results.brief_description: Impressions, without commentary, of the city of Rotterdam, which was devastated in 1940. The city is a living organism whose heart was torn away by the brute force of war. Among the ruins a new life has started up - in the docks, among the bombed-out ruins men are at work. In a mighty symphony of labour, the new city arises from the bomb sites and the dark ruins of old Rotterdam.

results.title: State plan for the development of intellectual disability services 1989-1992: a consumer's guide
results.creator_credit: Les Greenhill and CSV Community Services Victoria, IDS Public Education Unit
results.brief_description: A consumer’s overview of the State Plan for the development of Intellectual Disability Services which aims to help intellectually disabled people make decisions about their future regarding accomodation, employment, education, family support, recreation, rights and respite care. Discusses funding, changes in institutional care, assistance provided by the Community Living Support Service and the role of public education.

results.title: Standards at work; Living with standards
results.brief_description: Describes what Australian Standards are and how they affect everyone’s lives. Standards at work shows their use in improving product quality and Australias’ competitive edge and introduces the Supplier Assessment and Standards Mark Schemes. Living with standards shows how they are written, where they are applied, the principles of standardization and how they promote better quality in products and services.

results.title: Stairway to heaven
results.brief_description: This film deals with the study of astronomy from the time of the early Egyptians and Greeks, through the Middle Ages, when Galileo’s asertion that the earth moved revolutionised science, until the present day. The discovery of the telescope, and its development to the precision instrument it is today, is dealt with in detail.

results.title: Stages
results.creator_credit: Robert Mellor and Macau Light Films
results.brief_description: Stage and screen director Peter Brook and performers from the Centre for International Theatre discuss their approach to drama. Excerpts from the play “L’Os”, “Ubu Roi”, “The Ik” and “The Conference of the Birds” which were performed in a disused quarry during the 1980 Adelaide Festival of Arts, illustrate their innovative approach to theatre.
